Publi¢ Activity: One major public

investment is programmed for Fairfield.

*Masonville Marine Terminal - To
augment its enormously successful
container handling operations, the
Maryland Port Administration intends
to build a new 350-acre terminal
largely on filled land along the north-
west shore of the Fairfield peninsula.
With four berths, the new facility will
be capable of handling more than
three anillion tons of container cargo a
year when completed. Together with
the port administration’s other major
container facility, the Dundalk Marine
Terminal which presently handles
about 3 million tons of container
freight a year and the Canton/Seagirt
Marine Terminal now under construc-
tion, the new Masonville Terminal will
enable the port to meet expected
demand into the next century. Con-
struction of the terminal is currently
estimated at $112 million and will be
phased so that two berths will be
completed in the 1990s and another
two by 2000. Over seven million cubic

tra

Maryland Port Admi
